RationalPiano.Graphic
Class GraphicVerticalLineTriangle2

java.lang.Object
  RationalPiano.Graphic.GraphicVerticalLineTriangle2
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDrawable, IGraphicVisualizationElement
public class GraphicVerticalLineTriangle2
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGraphicVisualizationElement

Represents a vertical line with a changeable width. The width is drawn with a color transistion.

Version:
1.01
Author:
Fabian Ehrentraud
Licence:
Licensed under the Open Software License (OSL 3.0)
Date:
2010-07-26

Constructor Detail

GraphicVerticalLineTriangle2

public GraphicVerticalLineTriangle2(processing.core.PApplet papplet,
                                    int width,
                                    int height,
                                    int x_center,
                                    int y_top,
                                    double bend,
                                    int lineColorHueInactive,
                                    int lineColorHueActive,
                                    int lineColorSaturation,
                                    int lineColorBrightness)
Generates a new line

Parameters:
papplet - The processing applet to draw the note line to
width - Width of the line in pixels
height - Height of the line in pixels
x_center - X coordinate of the center of the line
y_top - Y coordinate of the top of the line
bend - 0lineColorHueInactive - Color hue of the lines that are not active. 0<=lineColorHueInactive<=255
lineColorHueActive - Color hue of the lines that are active. 0<=lineColorHueActive<=255
lineColorSaturation - Color saturation of the lines. 0<=lineColorSaturation<=255
lineColorBrightness - Color brightness of the lines. 0<=lineColorBrightness<=255

setStrokeColor

private void setStrokeColor(int distance,
                            double volume)
Sets the PApplets stroke color in dependence of the pixel distance from the center of the line

Parameters:
distance - The absolute distance in x-direction from the center of the line; distance >= 0
volume - The width to set the line to; 0<=volume<=1
